legend.layer: The Galleon layer name to use to provision the feature.
legend.description: The textual description of the layer.
legend.stability: One of default, community, preview and experimental. community and default stability features are available by default.
legend.note: To highlight a particularity that occurs when provisioning this layer.
legend.glowDiscoverable: WildFly Glow (CLI or support in the WildFly Maven Plugin), can discover the layer from the API used in your deployment. If false, it must be added using the WildFly Glow addOn name.
legend.glowAddOn: The name of the WildFly Glow addOn to use to provision this functionality when using Wildfly Glow.
legend.glowRules: The list of rules that WildFly Glow uses to discover that your deployment requires this layer (API in use, expected XML descriptor, ...).
legend.feature-pack: The Galleon feature-pack that defines the layer.
legend.managementModel: The part of the management model this layer brings to the server configuration. Can be empty if this layer only aggregates some layers.
legend.dependencies: The list of layers this layer depends on. Those layers are also provisioned when this layer is provisioned.
legend.configurations: Environment variables and system properties that can be used to configure the layer.
legend.modelReference: The model reference of the resources that this feature-pack can provision
legend.logMessagesReference: The log and exception messages codes and descriptions
legend.mavenCoordinates: The Maven GroupId, ArtifactId and Version of the feature-pack
legend.featurePackLocation: The XML content to configure the WildFly Maven Plugin to use this feature-pack
legend.packages: The packages (generally JBoss Modules modules) that this layer provision in addition of implict extension module.

featurePacks.name: WildFly Galleon feature-pack for the Cloud
featurePacks.description: This feature-pack adjusts the WildFly layers to run on the cloud.

featurePacks.name: AI Feature pack for WildFly
featurePacks.description: Feature pack to provide AI integration for WildFly

functionalities.name: base-server
functionalities.description: WildFly base server, adjusted for the cloud

glowRules.name: org.wildfly.rule.configuration
glowRules.ruleDescription: The URL where to find yaml file containing the configuration (env variables to configure the layer).
glowRules.valueDescription: e.g.: `https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jfdenise/wildfly-datasources-galleon-pack/layers_metadata/doc/mariadb/env.yaml`

functionalities.name: cloud-default-config
functionalities.description: A default configuration for the cloud. Note that all JBoss Modules modules are provisioned.

functionalities.name: ejb-dist-cache
functionalities.description: Infinispan-based distributed cache for stateful session beans, adjusted for the cloud

glowRules.name: org.wildfly.rule.configuration
glowRules.ruleDescription: The URL where to find yaml file containing the configuration (env variables to configure the layer).
glowRules.valueDescription: e.g.: `https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jfdenise/wildfly-datasources-galleon-pack/layers_metadata/doc/mariadb/env.yaml`

functionalities.name: elytron-oidc-client
functionalities.description: Support for securing deployment with OIDC, adjusted for the cloud

glowRules.name: org.wildfly.rule.configuration
glowRules.ruleDescription: The URL where to find yaml file containing the configuration (env variables to configure the layer).
glowRules.valueDescription: e.g.: `https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jfdenise/wildfly-datasources-galleon-pack/layers_metadata/doc/mariadb/env.yaml`

glowRules.name: org.wildfly.rule.no-configuration-if-org.wildfly.rule.expected-file-oidc
glowRules.ruleDescription: A conditional rule. Do not propose configuration if the condition is `true`. This rule name is followed by the conditioned rule: `org.wildfly.rule.no-configuration-if-<conditioned rule>`
glowRules.valueDescription: e.g.: `org.wildfly.rule.no-configuration-if-org.wildfly.rule.expected-file-oidc=/WEB-INF/oidc.json`, if `/WEB-INF/oidc.json` is found, do not propose Cloud specific OIDC environment variables.

functionalities.name: embedded-activemq
functionalities.description: Support for an embedded Apache Activemq Artemis Jakarta Messaging broker, adjusted for the cloud

functionalities.name: jpa
functionalities.description: Support for JPA (using the latest WildFly supported Hibernate release), adjusted for the cloud

functionalities.name: jpa-distributed
functionalities.description: Support for JPA with a distributed second level cache, adjusted for the cloud

glowRules.name: org.wildfly.rule.configuration
glowRules.ruleDescription: The URL where to find yaml file containing the configuration (env variables to configure the layer).
glowRules.valueDescription: e.g.: `https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jfdenise/wildfly-datasources-galleon-pack/layers_metadata/doc/mariadb/env.yaml`

glowRules.name: org.wildfly.rule.xml-path
glowRules.ruleDescription: Lookup of XML path inside a set of files. If multiple rules exist, the rule name can be extended with a suffix `<rule name>-<suffix>`
glowRules.valueDescription: Array of files followed by expected path and value. e.g.: `[/WEB-INF/.xml,/META-INF/.xml],/datasources/datasource/driver,h2`

glowRules.name: org.wildfly.rule.annotation.field.value-url
glowRules.ruleDescription: Expected annotation with field values. Field values can be regex. This rule can be added multiple time to a layer, it must contains a suffix to be unique.
glowRules.valueDescription: The annotation with a field value. For example: `jakarta.annotation.sql.DataSourceDefinition,className=org.h2.*`

glowRules.name: org.wildfly.rule.xml-path-xa
glowRules.ruleDescription: Lookup of XML path inside a set of files. If multiple rules exist, the rule name can be extended with a suffix `<rule name>-<suffix>`
glowRules.valueDescription: Array of files followed by expected path and value. e.g.: `[/WEB-INF/.xml,/META-INF/.xml],/datasources/datasource/driver,h2`

glowRules.name: org.wildfly.rule.annotation.field.value-className
glowRules.ruleDescription: Expected annotation with field values. Field values can be regex. This rule can be added multiple time to a layer, it must contains a suffix to be unique.
glowRules.valueDescription: The annotation with a field value. For example: `jakarta.annotation.sql.DataSourceDefinition,className=org.h2.*`

functionalities.name: ai
functionalities.description: Support for LangChain4j Integration

glowRules.name: org.wildfly.rule.class
glowRules.ruleDescription: A Java type.
glowRules.valueDescription: Comma separated list. Annotations are java package, full class or pattern ending with .*. e.g.: `jakarta.ws.rs,jakarta.ws.rs.core`

glowRules.name: org.wildfly.rule.annotations
glowRules.ruleDescription: Expected annotations
glowRules.valueDescription: Comma separated list. Annotations are java package, full class or pattern ending with .*. e.g.: `org.eclipse.microprofile.config.inject`

functionalities.name: chat-memory-provider
functionalities.description: Support for ChatMemory

glowRules.name: org.wildfly.rule.annotation.field.value
glowRules.ruleDescription: Expected annotation with field values. Field values can be regex. This rule can be added multiple time to a layer, it must contains a suffix to be unique.
glowRules.valueDescription: The annotation with a field value. For example: `jakarta.annotation.sql.DataSourceDefinition,className=org.h2.*`

glowRules.name: org.wildfly.rule.configuration
glowRules.ruleDescription: The URL where to find yaml file containing the configuration (env variables to configure the layer).
glowRules.valueDescription: e.g.: `https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jfdenise/wildfly-datasources-galleon-pack/layers_metadata/doc/mariadb/env.yaml`

glowRules.name: org.wildfly.rule.annotated.type
glowRules.ruleDescription: Expected annotated type, annotation and annotation field values. Field values can be regex. This rule can take a suffix and be used multiple times for a given layer.
glowRules.valueDescription: The type followed by the annotation (with some optional field=value). For example: `org.example.MyType,org.example.MyAnnotation[field1=foo,field2=bar*]`

glowRules.name: org.wildfly.rule.expect-add-on-family
glowRules.ruleDescription: Family of add-on expected by the layer.
glowRules.valueDescription: e.g.: `messaging`

glowRules.ruleDescription: Expected annotation with field values. Field values can be regex. This rule can be added multiple time to a layer, it must contains a suffix to be unique.
glowRules.valueDescription: The annotation with a field value. For example: `jakarta.annotation.sql.DataSourceDefinition,className=org.h2.*`

glowRules.name: org.wildfly.rule.configuration
glowRules.ruleDescription: The URL where to find yaml file containing the configuration (env variables to configure the layer).
glowRules.valueDescription: e.g.: `https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jfdenise/wildfly-datasources-galleon-pack/layers_metadata/doc/mariadb/env.yaml`

glowRules.name: org.wildfly.rule.annotated.type
glowRules.ruleDescription: Expected annotated type, annotation and annotation field values. Field values can be regex. This rule can take a suffix and be used multiple times for a given layer.
glowRules.valueDescription: The type followed by the annotation (with some optional field=value). For example: `org.example.MyType,org.example.MyAnnotation[field1=foo,field2=bar*]`

glowRules.name: org.wildfly.rule.hidden-if-org.wildfly.rule.not-expected-file-keycloak
glowRules.ruleDescription: A conditional rule to hide a layer if the condition is `true`. This rule name is followed by the conditioned rule: `org.wildfly.rule.hidden-if-<conditioned rule>`
glowRules.valueDescription: e.g.: rule `org.wildfly.rule.hidden-if-org.wildfly.rule.not-expected-file=/WEB-INF/keycloak.json`, `keycloak-client-saml` layer is hidden if `/WEB-INF/keycloak.json` is not present.

glowRules.name: org.wildfly.rule.configuration
glowRules.ruleDescription: The URL where to find yaml file containing the configuration (env variables to configure the layer).
glowRules.valueDescription: e.g.: `https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jfdenise/wildfly-datasources-galleon-pack/layers_metadata/doc/mariadb/env.yaml`

glowRules.name: org.wildfly.rule.no-configuration-if-org.wildfly.rule.expected-file-keycloak
glowRules.ruleDescription: A conditional rule. Do not propose configuration if the condition is `true`. This rule name is followed by the conditioned rule: `org.wildfly.rule.no-configuration-if-<conditioned rule>`
glowRules.valueDescription: e.g.: `org.wildfly.rule.no-configuration-if-org.wildfly.rule.expected-file-oidc=/WEB-INF/oidc.json`, if `/WEB-INF/oidc.json` is found, do not propose Cloud specific OIDC environment variables.

glowRules.name: org.wildfly.rule.configuration
glowRules.ruleDescription: The URL where to find yaml file containing the configuration (env variables to configure the layer).
glowRules.valueDescription: e.g.: `https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jfdenise/wildfly-datasources-galleon-pack/layers_metadata/doc/mariadb/env.yaml`

glowRules.name: org.wildfly.rule.configuration
glowRules.ruleDescription: The URL where to find yaml file containing the configuration (env variables to configure the layer).
glowRules.valueDescription: e.g.: `https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jfdenise/wildfly-datasources-galleon-pack/layers_metadata/doc/mariadb/env.yaml`

functionalities.name: mcp
functionalities.description: Support for MCP subsystem

glowRules.name: org.wildfly.rule.class
glowRules.ruleDescription: A Java type.
glowRules.valueDescription: Comma separated list. Annotations are java package, full class or pattern ending with .*. e.g.: `jakarta.ws.rs,jakarta.ws.rs.core`

glowRules.name: org.wildfly.rule.annotations
glowRules.ruleDescription: Expected annotations
glowRules.valueDescription: Comma separated list. Annotations are java package, full class or pattern ending with .*. e.g.: `org.eclipse.microprofile.config.inject`
